greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = mu(prime(n)-1), where mu is the Moebius function (A008683).
comment: Note that A049092 lists prime(n) such that a(n) = 0. Similarly, A078330 lists prime(n) such that a(n) = -1. See A088179 for prime(n) such that a(n) = 1. Also note that a(n) == A088144(n) (mod prime(n)).
reference: J. V. Uspensky and M. A. Heaslet, Elementary Number Theory, McGraw-Hill, NY, 1939, p. 236.
link: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Ed Pegg, Jr., Moebius Function (and squarefree numbers)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Moebius Function
formula: If p = prime(n), then a(n) is congruent modulo p to the sum of all primitive roots modulo p. [Uspensky and Heaslet]. - _Michael Somos_, Feb 16 2020
xref: Cf. A089495 (mu(p+1) for prime p), A089496 (mu(p+1)+mu(p-1) for prime p), A089497 (mu(p+1)-mu(p-1) for prime p).
results.author: _T. D. Noe_, Nov 03 2003
